Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2018 06:48PM kaufmanscsi wrote: Thank you so much for getting back to me. I also may have malignant lymph nodes that could be pressing on some GI nerves causing these problems. I am now on Kadcyla so perhaps that's causing the problem....
Posts.Title: Y90 kaufmanscsi kaufmanscsi

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2018 12:08PM kaufmanscsi wrote: Hi there! Just started it on Monday for malignancy in lymph node which came up recently after progression of a tiny liver met. I have been feeling crappy but that is likely due to the lymph nodes pressing on a GI nerve and/or the fact that I got Y90 embolization about a month ago to the liver met. I am not happy about having to switch off of Herceptin Perjeta. I hope for few side effects.
Posts.Title: Who's on Kadcyla/TDM1? Trish03 Denny123

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2018 02:09PM kaufmanscsi wrote: Wanting you to know that I had Y90 to my liver (one node) and it worked beautifully! No sites since February!
Posts.Title: How are people with liver mets doing? blondie1 JFL

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2018 11:02PM kaufmanscsi wrote: Hi Grannax2. Thanks for the link. I0 years ago I had bone mets. It returned only to liver 1.5 years ago. Mets basically disappeared with Herceptin, Perjeta and Taxotere and Faslodex.  One met grew slightly in January which prompted the Y90. I was going to stay on the H, P, and T indefinitely, but then they noticed these lymph nodes. I am just exhausted and my GI system is all messed up. I have trouble eating various things (high fat, spicy, fibrous veggies). I am working and functional, but just don't feel good. I can't figure out what is causing all of this. I am going to see GI doc in a week so hopefully he will have some ideas. I am also hoping that once the Kadcyla kicks in the lymph nodes will shrink and that might cause some relief.
